case_vignette: A 25-year-old man presents to the emergency department with altered mental status. The patient has not been feeling well since yesterday, and this morning his roommate found him unarousable. The patient is generally healthy and is a college athlete. He recently broke his nose in a soccer game, and it is currently healing with only gauze in his nose to stop occasional bleeding. He otherwise has no significant medical history. His temperature is 102°F (38.9°C), blood pressure is 87/58 mmHg, pulse is 130/min, respirations are 24/min, and oxygen saturation is 98% on room air. Physical exam is notable for the finding in Figure A.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Infectious Diseases. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been feeling unwell since yesterday and today I woke up feeling very out of it, my friend couldn't even wake me up.
Great, thank you for sharing that information. Can you tell me more about your fever? How high is it and how long have you had it?
My temperature is 102°F, and I've been feeling unwell since yesterday.
Okay, thank you for letting me know. Have you noticed any other symptoms such as a sore throat, cough, or body aches?
No, I haven't noticed symptoms like a sore throat, cough, or body aches.
Okay, that's helpful to know. Have you had any recent travel or been exposed to anyone with similar symptoms?
No, I haven't traveled recently or been around anyone with similar symptoms.
Okay, that's good to know. Have you noticed any changes in your appetite or energy levels?
Yes, I've not been feeling well since yesterday which may have affected my appetite and energy levels.

Okay, thank you for letting me know. Based on what you've told me, I would like to schedule a follow-up appointment with you to further evaluate your symptoms and determine the cause of your illness. Would that be okay with you?
Yes, that would be okay with me.

Great! I'm glad you're willing to work with me to get to the bottom of your symptoms. In the meantime, I would recommend that you stay hydrated by drinking plenty of fluids, such as water or clear broth. You can also take over-the-counter medication like acetaminophen or ibuprofen to help manage your fever and body aches. Just make sure to follow the instructions on the label and only take the recommended dose.

I will follow up with you soon to schedule an appointment and further evaluate your symptoms. In the meantime, if your symptoms worsen or you experience any shortness of breath or chest pain, please seek medical attention immediately.

Thank you for entrusting me with your care.

**Final Diagnosis:** Acute viral illness (e.g. common cold or flu)
